ygData.subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Kunark is here! Are lizards better?
ygData.msgSnippet: I thought that my troll shaman would be a great canadate to take to Kunark, cause he was evil and worshiped the same god as the monks of the Iskar.  Man was I
ygData.messageBody:
I thought that my troll shaman would be a great canadate to take to Kunark, cause he was evil and worshiped the same god as the monks of the Iskar.  Man was I wrong.  The only thing so far I have found in kurnark that are NOT hostile to my trollie, is the little town in The Overthere, which is a bunch of evil races in an encapment.  If I wasn't a shaman, I couldn't bind there, and I cant hunt there because everything is blood red, and scowling.  I made my way to the iskar city, with a little luck and help from sow, and found they are scowling and ready to attack.  So I made my way to the good elf encampent, and guess what?  Scowling no less.  Does any one know of a race that the iskar ARE friendly to?
 
Shelza, Karana
----- Original Message -----
From: Jeffrey Sue
To: EQ-Monks@egroups.com
Sent: Monday, April 24, 2000 2:57 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ-Monks] Kunark is here! Are lizards better?

well being evil is a pain in the ass unless you are willing to work on factions.
i was just pointing out that being able to kill goodie goodie guards is not one
of the advantages to being evil, since the goodie goodie races kill goodie goodie
guards as well.  and actually maybe have an easier time of it than evil
races, since they could kill guards til faction drops to apprehensive and then
do quests to knock it back up again, whereas the evil folks have a hell of
a time doing side quests just so they can get non-kos so they can do the real
faction quests.

At 11:29 AM 4/24/00 -0500, you wrote:
>Jeffrey Sue writes:
>
> > of course faction doesn't stop druids from killing goodie goodie
> > npc's.
>
>Hell no.
>
>My point was that being evil is NOT the bad thing that a lot make it
>out to be.  It's actually quite a good thing in many ways.
>
